text:
Hi everyone, great job on HubSpot !

Maybe I missed it but do you use a plugin or something to remove Hubl errors in your css/sass files?
Thanks :)
Please anyone help me fix this issue
Please help me how to fix this issue
For the record, `export_to_template_context` did what I needed but I ended up setting up a regular module instead so that it’s easier to edit…
I guess it’s easy to include a default module like `@HubSpot/text` but `<h1><span>This makes me uncomfortable</span></h1>`

and this:
```<h1><div id="hs_cos_wrapper_text" class="hs_cos_wrapper hs_cos_wrapper_widget hs_cos_wrapper_type_module widget-type-text" style="" data-hs-cos-general-type="widget" data-hs-cos-type="module"><span id="hs_cos_wrapper_text_" class="hs_cos_wrapper hs_cos_wrapper_widget hs_cos_wrapper_type_text" style="" data-hs-cos-general-type="widget" data-hs-cos-type="text">some text here</span></div></h1>```
:dizzy_face:
<@U22VBL87M> I assume it’s impossible to have the same editing highlighters by adding a predefined class?
Since it mentions sudo, do you have admin rights?

> <@U22VBL87M> I assume it’s impossible to have the same editing highlighters by adding a predefined class?
That is correct. You’re feedback is good feedback that we’ll need to consider as we work on improvements.
you likely need to change your file type or download an add on for hubl in your code editor. Those aren't really errors.. your editor just doesn't understand it is using a templating language
did you use that command that it says to do?
